text: [Music]
if the if the United States has some
role in uh spreading values that we
associate with the enlightenment like
like tolerance and reason and skepticism
and so on then it clearly
can't hold itself as a as exceptional it
can't say that there is something unique
special about the United States because
it's the United States and hope anyone
else to take them
seriously in doing so that would be
immediately contradicting the very idea
that it would be nice to spread namely
that no entity is Special by virtue of
being that entity it's got to make its
case to other entities that a priori are
considered to be equal Partners in the
conversation so while I think it's okay
to say for United States and and other
liberal democracies to say we found a
system that works uh here's why it works
here's what's good about it they can't
do it by virtue by saying uh we're going
to impose it because we're us and we can
do we can do that those two ideas are
are in contradiction the whole advantage
of liberal democracy is that you make
your case not because of who you are but
because you've got a good case and you
can persuade others and that you don't
privilege your own own vantage point
over theirs
